clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Carbon dioxide is commonly used as an insufflation gas for minimal invasive surgery laparoscopy endoscopy and arthroscopy to enlarge and stabilize body cavities to provide better visibility of the surgical area It has been used also in cryotherapy and as respiratory stimulant before and after anesthesia It could be used also in expansion of blood vessels if required to increase carbon dioxide level after rapid breathing and to stimulate breathing after a period of nonbreathing

contraindications.disease: Signs of intoxication have been produced by a 30 minute exposure at 50 000 ppm and a few minutes exposure at 70 000 to 100 000 ppm produces unconsciousness
